Investigation Interviews
On 8/26/25 an interview was completed with Compliance at Vista
Maria. He confirmed that Staff 1 is currently on administrative
leave. He identified Youth A and Youth B as the youth associated
with the investigation. Compliance denied knowledge of any other
youth reporting concerns with Staff 1 or any other staff placing
their penis on the youth during a restraint. Compliance further
advised that Staff 10 completed the incident report. Compliance
denied any history of Staff 1 being involved in this type of behavior
or allegation. He reported Staff 1 having been involved in many
restraints in the past without any concerns. Compliance reported
Youth C was present and witnessed a restraint completed by Staff
1.
On 8/26/2025 an attempt was made to interview Youth B at Vista
Maria. She refused to be interviewed.
On 8/26/2025 an interview was completed with Youth A at Vista
Maria. She confirmed that she has been at the facility for 6 months
and advised that she is working toward her discharge plan. She
denied a recent restraint involving Staff 1. She did recall that back
in July (after the 4th) being involved in a restraint with Staff 1 in
the front hall at Beata. She reported a clear was called as she
was banging on windows. She stated that Staff 1 restrained her
and during the restraint he grabbed her breast. She denied that it
seemed accidental. She stated the restraint lasted for about 5
minutes and that Staff 1 had his hand on her breast for the entire
five minutes. She denied that any other staff were involved in the
restraint and was unable to advise what type of restraint technique
the staff was using. Youth A denied that she reported it to any
staff. She stated she was afraid to tell anyone. She recalled that
Youth C was present and saw it. Youth A reported that she has
seen a restraint by Staff 1 occur with Youth B. She stated that
Staff 1 was inappropriately touching Youth B. Youth A could not
recall the date or the location of the restraint nor was she able to
provide specific details relative to how Staff 1 allegedly
inappropriately touched Youth B or where he inappropriately
touched Youth B.
2

On 09/05/2025 another onsite interview was completed with
Youth A at Vista Maria along with DHHS Specialist. Youth A
stated she did not want to talk about the situation with Staff 1.
She stated he no longer worked at the agency, so why should it
be talked about. After being asked follow up questions, Youth A
stated Youth D told her that Staff 1 touched her breast. Youth A
then quickly again stated she doesn’t want to talk about it. She
requested to end the interview and walked out of the room.
On 9/03/2025 and 10/01/2025 a telephone call was attempted to
father of Youth C. The contact number was not valid.
On 9/3/2025 a phone call was made to Complainant. The
contact number was not valid. An email was sent to Compliance
requesting updated number. On 10/02/2025 a phone call was
made to Complainant and no additional concerns were expressed.
On 9/3/2025 email sent to Foster Care Worker 1, Foster Care
Worker 2 and Foster Care Manager advising of investigation
involving youth assigned to their caseload. Foster Care Worker 1
responded via email and indicated no concerns. To date, no
response has been received from Foster Care Worker 2.
On 09/05/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Staff 1
at Vista Maria. The DHHS Specialist was also present. Staff 1
denied being involved in any restraint with agency youth on
7/4/25; specifically not Youth A or Youth B. Video footage from a
restraint involving Staff 1 and Youth A dated 8/15/2025 was
reviewed along with Staff 1 and DHHS Specialist. Staff 1 recalled
that Youth A was trying to get to Youth D and staff was attempting
to redirect the behavior. Youth A was not responding to
redirection and began to hit at staff and as a result she was
physically managed. Staff 1 denied that he has ever been
inappropriate with youth at the facility. Specifically, he denied
placing his penis on youth while restraining them. He further
denied ever hurting youth at the facility. He recalled that Youth D
stated he grabbed her arm and twisted it during a restraint, but he
denied that was true. The allegations were investigated as a part
of Special Investigation 2025SIC0000670. Staff 1 also denied that
he is ever behind youth when physically managing, stating that he
is always on the side. Staff 1 denied grabbing or touching the
breast of the youth during a restraint. Staff 1 denied restraining a
youth alone and reminded that agency policy does not allow single
person restraints. Staff 1 denied that youth have ever made
comments to him about feeling uncomfortable or him having been
3

inappropriate with them. Lastly Staff 1 denied seeing other staff
be sexually inappropriate with youth.
On 09/05/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
B at Vista Maria along with the DHHS Specialist. Youth B stated
that she does not feel safe because Vista Maria is not the place
for her. She stated that Staff 1 and Staff 11 make her feel unsafe
because they are aggressive. She stated she did not know if it
was true, but she heard that Staff 1 was in a restraint with Youth A
and put his “dick on her ass”. She stated that she was told that
Staff 1 would not stop and would not move. Youth B also stated
she heard it happened with another youth but could not recall her
name and stated she was no longer at the facility. She also
reported that Youth D stated Staff 1 did the same thing to her also.
Youth B denied Staff 1 has ever restrained her and she also
denied ever seeing him restrain another youth. She reported that
Staff 11 choked her, it was investigated and nothing happened.
This allegation was investigated under Special Investigation
2025SIC0000926. Youth B further denied that she is ever alone
with Staff 11 or Staff 1. She also denied that Staff 1 has touched
her inappropriately.
On 09/05/2025 an in-person interview occurred with Youth D at
Vista Maria along with DHHS Specialist. She reported that she
does not feel safe at Vista Maria because it is a lot going on here
and not much that can be done about it. Youth D was unwilling or
unable to further expand on what she meant by a lot going on and
nothing can be done. She stated that Staff 1 twisted her arm in
the past (this was investigated as a part of Special Investigation
2025SIC0000670). She denied that Staff 1 or any other Vista staff
have touched her inappropriately during a restraint. Youth D
reported that Youth E originally told her that Staff 1 touched her
inappropriately by standing to close to her during a restraint, but
the youth is now saying that it did not happen. Youth D also
reported she recalled being present when Youth A was restrained
and denied that she witnessed anything inappropriate occur. She
stated the restraint seemed completed appropriately.
On 09/05/2025 Youth E was interviewed at Vista Maria along with
DHHS Specialist. Youth E denied that she was restrained or
touched inappropriately by any staff member. She recalled
hearing that Youth D was restrained and had her wrist hurt but
denied knowing what staff was involved. She denied having
knowledge of a staff member restraining youth and placing his
penis against their body. She denied that she has ever been
touched inappropriately by staff during a restraint.
4

On 09/05/2025 Staff 2 was interviewed at Vista Maria along with
DHHS Specialist. She denied having knowledge or seeing Staff 1
do a restraint and pushing his penis up against a youth or
touching them inappropriately. She denied that Staff 1 has ever
restrained a youth inappropriately in her presence. Staff 2 also
confirmed that she was present when Staff 1 restrained Youth A
and denied seeing anything inappropriate. Lastly, Staff 2
confirmed that she has completed and submitted an incident
report based on a report from Youth A that Staff 1 had pressed
her breast in a very aggressive manner during a restraint.
On 9/10/2025 Staff 3 was interviewed at Vista Maria along with
DHHS Specialist. She is a Campus Coordinator with Vista and
has been employed since June 2024. She reported being familiar
with Staff 1 and has heard youth at the agency state that they
don’t like Staff 1 and that he gets on their nerves. Staff 3 denied
knowing why youth would say that. Staff 3 reported finding Staff 1
to be appropriate with the youth. She recalled the restraint that
Staff 1 completed with Youth A and reported that it was done
appropriately. She denied knowledge of or hearing youth report
Staff 1 had been inappropriate with them or had placed his penis
on them when doing a restraint. She further reported having been
present for other restraints that have been completed by Staff 1
and has never seen them be inappropriate.
On 9/10/2025 phone call was made to Staff 4. A message was
left for him to return the call. To date no response has been
received. Staff 4 was scheduled to be interviewed during an
onsite visit, but did not show up for work on that day.
On 09/10/2025 a return call was received from Staff 8. DHHS
Specialist was also present. Staff 8 confirmed she was no longer
employed with Vista Maria as of 8/28/2025. She reported being
familiar with Staff 1. She denied seeing Staff 1 do anything
inappropriate to youth during a restraint. She confirmed that she
has heard youth at Vista Maria say that he is inappropriate with
them but denied that they reported anything specific. She also
could not recall the youths names. Staff 8 did report that Youth E
told her that she heard Staff 1 pushed his penis against Youth D
during a restraint. Staff 8 denied that Youth D had ever reported
that to her. Staff 8 again denied seeing any inappropriate action
by Staff 1 and stated that she feels the youth just don’t like him
and the structure and discipline he tries to enforce when he is
working.
5

On 09/10/2025 Staff 3, Staff 4, Staff 6, Staff 7 and Staff 9 were
all interviewed at Vista Maria along with the DHHS Specialist. All
staff denied having knowledge of or seeing Staff 1 engage in an
inappropriate restraint or push his penis against a youth when
doing a restraint. All staff also denied hearing any of the youth
complain about Staff 1 touching them inappropriately or complain
about Staff 1 putting his penis against them during a restraint.
On 9/18/2025 a DHHS Case Closing meeting was held via Video
Conference. DHHS Specialist, DHHS Supervisor and DCWL Area
Manager participated.
On 10/01/2025 a telephone call was made to Staff 10. She
confirmed that she was present and a part of the restraint
involving Youth A and Staff 1. She denied that Staff 1 engaged in
any type of inappropriate behavior during the restraint. Staff 10
denied ever seeing or hearing that Staff 1 has placed his penis on
youth during restraints. Staff 10 further denied that any other
youth has expressed any concern to her regarding Staff 1.
Documents Reviewed
Vista Maria Staff and Client Interaction Policy - All Vista Maria
staff should conduct themselves in a professional and appropriate
manner when interacting with the clients in our care. Employees
are expected to establish good working relationships to foster
mutual trust with clients. If you are ever in doubt as to what is
appropriate, consult your immediate supervisor or a member of
management. NOTE: Violation of this policy may result in
disciplinary action, up to and including immediate termination of
employment.
Vista Maria Behavior Management Policy – To maintain a safe
environment for all Vista Maria clients and staff, behavior
management interventions are only used when a client presents a
danger to self or others. These interventions should only be used
when all other less restrictive behavior management interventions
(i.e., verbal de-escalation, therapeutic interventions) have been
explored.
To prevent the need for behavior management interventions, Vista
Maria staff serve as role models to our clients by building and
maintaining a therapeutic alliance and strengthening youth self-
capacities. Vista Maria staff will continuously provide a safe,
supportive, and nurturing environment in which each client can
learn and practice coping and de-escalation mechanisms that
work best for each individual.
6

Incident Report 3985
Dated 07/31/25 and submitted by Staff 2. In summary, it indicated
that it was reported by Youth A that Staff 1 had touched her. Staff
2 spoke with Youth A and asked for an explanation. Youth A
reported that during a previous incident, several months ago, Staff
1 restrained her and pressed her breast against his knee area.
Youth A denied that she had reported it to staff, management or a
nurse at the time. Youth A further indicated she did not like Staff 1
because he restrains too hard. When asked for clarification,
Youth A denied that Staff 1 touched her inappropriately but
confirmed that he pressed against her breast too hard.
Incident Report 4008
Dated 08/05/2025 at approximately 7pm and submitted by Staff 4.
In summary, it indicated Youth A came in from the courtyard
escalated as a result of one of her peers and began yelling on the
wing and accusing peers of talking about her. Youth A pushed
passed staff to exit the wing and began hitting on the visitation
room window and attempting to argue with Youth D. Youth A
remained escalated and failed to respond to redirection from
several staff. Youth A became physically and verbally aggressive
with staff and she was placed in a high hold restraint. Staff 1,
Staff 4 and Staff 10 were involved in the restraint. It lasted for 2 to
3 minutes and then Youth A was released from the hold.
Human Resource file of Staff 1 documented the following:
09/12/24-Written (Employee Behavior violation)
08/30/24-Verbal (Employee Behavior violation)
05/07/24-Memo to file-cell phone usage.
Video Reviewed
On 8/15/2025 video footage of a restraint involving Youth A, Staff
1, Staff 10 and Staff 4. Youth A was seen to be escalating and
was pacing back and forth in the hallway outside of the wing near
the family visitation room. Youth D was in the visitation room with
other staff and Youth A is seen banging on the windows and
attempting to get into the room where Youth D is. Staff are seen
making an attempt to redirect Youth A without success. At the
point of 7:11 of the video, Youth A becomes physically aggressive
with staff and is placed in a restraint by Staff 1 and Staff 10. Staff
4 comes in to assist after about 7:13 and the restraint continues
for an additional 30 to 35 seconds. No inappropriate actions of
any staff are seen during the restraint. Specifically, Staff 1 is only
seen standing to the side of Youth A during the restraint.
7

Tour of Agency
A tour of the incident area was completed on 09/05/2025 along
with DHHS Specialist. There were no areas of concern noted.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule. Interviews were completed
with staff and youth at the facility and there was no evidence to
support inappropriate actions by Staff 1 during restraints.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
